data.title: Outstanding seafood
data.text: I finally went to Chuck's. I could never get in on ballgame weekends and on Tuesday before my daughter's fall break I finally went. I am not a big sushi fan but it was outstanding and all made fresh. The cocktails are some of the best I have ever had. It is a wonderful venue with a great vibe-modern, upbeat with outstanding fresh food. And they take reservations most of the time.

data.title: Recommend for food and service
data.text: We have eaten at Chuck's Fish many times and all have been delicious meals.  The menu has many choices and the sushi selections are very plentiful.  We have also attended a banquet meal there and it was equally good in both service and food.  The bands who entertain there are also very good--especially the Lava Lamps.

data.title: Unhappy customers
data.text: We had been eating at Chucks for a few years .  Last time we got there early and was told we could pick a table and they would be serving in about 10 minutes. We knew they did not take reservations so picked a table near the window we had sat at before. As the restaurant began to fill we were told we could not sit there and was told to move to a table further back where all waiters passed by from the kitchen. Soon they seated someone at our first table.  We never went back.

data.title: Second visit, each time very good
data.text: Enjoyed a pleasant meal at Chucks. Service was very good. Attentive and knowledgeable. Had local beers and a very good strawberry mojito.  Apps were spring rolls and a seafood spread. Both were good, spread could have used a few more pita chips. Main course was the Parmesan Catch which was fresh grouper on risotto. It was excellent. Also had seafood plater. While good, a little more seafood would have been nice. Also had spring rolls. Desserts were very good. We shared the bread pudding and a blonde brownie Sunday. Both were worth the calories. Get there early or plan on waiting.

data.title: Good Food, Casual Dining
data.text: Casual atmosphere with good food.  The menu includes many options for all wallet sizes.  You can eat cheap or a more white table cloth meal.  Perfect for a college town.  Had the grouper.  Cooked perfectly.

data.title: Great local restaurant.
data.text: Well appointed . Great selection especially surprised at the fresh fish selections. Friendly atmosphere. First time there but will go back.

data.title: There's something on the menu for everyone!
data.text: I've eaten here multiple times and just when I think I can't love this place more..... It keeps getting better!   Go early because it gets packed, and there is a band Friday nights typically.  They will cater the food to you if you are vegan or have food allergies.

data.title: Good place, cool setting
data.text: Stopped in early on a football weekend Friday and got seated quickly. Place filled up by 6:00. Very attentive waitress with lots of energy! My son and I had the seafood platter, the stuffed shrimp was delicious. My wife had the scallops with collards. She doesn't like collards but I do and they were flavorful! We didn't have dessert, too full. I regret not having the okra, must order a dude if that next time!

data.title: Local flabor
data.text: This restaurant is unique and has great food. Everything I ever ordered has been phenomenal. Pizza or fish- both are wonderful.

data.title: Over-priced for the quality and service.
data.text:
Don't get me wrong, the food was good. But, not good enough for their prices. 
I had the Blackened Grouper. It was good, would like for it to have been spicier.  Don't waste your money on the fried oyster appetizer, not much oyster and a lot of fried batter. Their fried green tomatoes were ok.  We also got a sushi appetizer...they aren't a sushi restaurant, I'll leave it at that.  Also, service was slow and the restaurant was only half full. 
The waitress was not very personable or professional, she was hard to understand. 
Their bread pudding is excellent though.

data.title: Off the menu sushi
data.text: Great food but my favorite is the sushi - but best ones are not on the menu. My personal fav is the "Screaming O".  They also have a donkey roll and a 5th lights district that are not on the menu that some other people that were with us got. The Uptown shrimp is the best appetizer.

data.title: Great service, good food
data.text: Fish is very fresh, but preparation was just okay, not nearly as flavorful as menu description led us to expect. Homemade toasted coconut ice cream was wonderful. Our server, Michael, was really good, personable yet professional, he really added to our enjoyment of the evening. Had a great table by the windows in the corner of the "back" room, very cozy & private even though the restaurant was busy.

data.title: Hands down THE best sushi in Tuscaloosa
data.text:
HANDS DOWN (and this is agreed upon by many of my friends, who may not bother to do a review, but SHOULD) ... THE best sushi in Tuscaloosa. I have been going there for years, and used to every Tuesday with a group of "girls" for Ladies Night (1/2 price wine). Although I go more infrequently now, it NEVER disappoints. I was not even a big sushi fan until I had it at Chuck's... it is SO fresh, and perfect, that I am spoiled and cannot handle anything less anywhere else. The sashimi appetizer is also SOOOOO good ... the freshest (and prettiest too!) tuna and salmon. I am craving sushi as I write this. ... My favorites? The Dat or the Amazon. A friend and I got the Kaos roll once - VERY spicy, so beware of that one if that is not your thing. Be sure to try the Uptown Shrimp at least once - similar to the Bang Bang Shrimp at Bonefish Grill. They used to do a pretty good discount on the Uptown Shrimp on Wednesdays, I believe, but I am not sure if that is still the case. 

For your dinner entrée, if you want to spring for the filet, it is WORTH it. One of the best pieces of red meat I have had in Tuscaloosa - melt in your mouth, cooked to perfection (I get mine medium rare). 

Also, remember 1/2 price wine on Tuesdays. And this may sound silly to some, but their wine glasses are thin-lipped, which somehow makes the wine taste a little better to me, and it just "feels" better. And the wine is always perfectly chilled. 

I don't have a negative word to say about Chuck's: every food item on their menu - absolutely fresh, the highest quality, and prepared perfectly; the atmosphere - wonderful - so nice and cozy, but not too formal; the service - not a lot of turnover with staff, even over YEARS of coming in, which speaks volumes for ownership / management, and they ALWAYS remember who I am and what I like - much appreciated. 

If I could give them more than 5 stars, I would!

data.title: Outstanding
data.text: Outstanding food, creative dishes and cool atmosphere.  One of Tuscaloosa best restaurants for a reason

data.title: Another night at Chucks
data.text: This restaurant has proven that it is going to be here forever , sensitive to customers needs , always fresh products, great service and a wonderful atmosphere . You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Sushi night
data.text: Very nice atmosphere.  Downtown easy to walk to campus and government park.  Great food and sushi but tables to close to each other.

data.title: Great sushi!
data.text: We went to Chucks Fish for our anniversary and it was delicious! The sushi was amazing. The wine was great too. Definitely worth a trip to check it out. I've heard the regular menu is great too - but if you like sushi, try it! Best place for sushi in Tuscaloosa!

data.title: Very Disappointed
data.text: We heard that Chuck's Fish was the seafood restaurant to try out while in Tuscaloosa. We were not impressed at all. The food was very pricey and was just..ok. We noticed that other servers gave their guest a bread basket before the meal. Our server didn't ask if we wanted one or not. We just didn't get one. My husband ordered a seafood platter for $30!! He had one small piece of fish and 2 shrimp. They gave two types of fish as an option but didn't ask which he wanted they chose it for him. I had the pork chop. It was ok. The sauce on it was actually pretty good. We like to visit local restaurants when we go to a new  city. This is one we won't visit again if ever in there.

data.title: Excellent sushi!
data.text: was in Tuscaloosa for a week for work and tried many different restaurants in town. Chucks was my favorite. I went on a Friday right when Univ of Bama was starting so it was SUPER busy. 1 hour wait for a table. TIP: the sushi bar upstairs and tables are first come first serve (no wait). Because of the wait we decided to eat at the sushi bar upstairs and I gotta say, the sushi was superb. All fresh. I had the Rainbow roll, eel, and bama roll. Excellent service and quick. Wish I had time while in town to eat there again. Would definitely go back.

data.title: Delicious as usual
data.text: Love the sushi. Best in town! Great for double dates, dinner with friends, etc. They don't take reservations, so be prepared to wait if on a weekend night.
